Rule.Name: Flat Bottom Holes
Rule.Summary: It is recommended to use conical bottom hole, when hole is manufactured with drilling. It is recommended to use flat bottom hole, when hole is manufactured with milling.

Rule.Name: Deep Radiused Corners
Rule.Summary: The ratio of the depth of an internal corner of milled region to its radius should be <= 16.0.

Rule.Name: Sharp Internal Corners
Rule.Summary: Milled pockets/slots should not have sharp internal corners.

Rule.Name: Fillets On Top Edges
Rule.Summary: Edges on the tops of pockets, bosses, and slots should be chamfered and not filleted.

Rule.Name: Pockets With Bottom Chamfers
Rule.Summary: Milled pockets and bosses should not have a chamfer between the side walls and its base.

Rule.Name: Non Uniform Draft Features
Rule.Summary: All walls of tapered pockets, bosses and slots should be defined with a constant taper angle.

Rule.Name: Deep - Narrow Slots
Rule.Summary: The ratio of cross section area to the depth of a milled pocket should be >= 0.8 mm.

Rule.Name: Partial Holes
Rule.Summary: When a hole intersects with the side of a feature, >= 75.0 percent of the area of the hole should be within material.

Rule.Name: Standard Hole Sizes
Rule.Summary: Holes should conform to standard hole diameters.

Rule.Name: Holes Intersecting Cavities
Rule.Summary: Holes should not intersect a cavity. If an intersection is unavoidable, at a minimum, the centerline of the hole should be outside the cavity.

Rule.Name: Tool Accessibility
Rule.Summary: Features should be accessible to the cutting tool in the preferred machining orientation.

Rule.Name: Narrow Regions In Pockets
Rule.Summary: To minimize the use of small tools, distance between features / model faces of milled regions should be >= 3.0 mm and the ratio of depth of milling region to its width should be <= 10.0.

Parameter.Name: Select the drill diameter to delete
